text: The runtime for serverless functions is Node 18 on <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/platform-versioning|developer platform> "2023.2"
There are no other apps available in this serverless runtime

We’re looking at the attachments section in the CRM, it looks like it’s available on any of the objects, including our custom objects.   We are able to get the ID of these attachments but can’t seem to figure out how to get the name or title of the file.

:new: :boom: *Custom logger API to debug extension failures in-production*

When an extension fails to load or function during it's usage in production by end users, it's difficult to find out what led to that failure. Custom `logger` API allows you to send customized log messages to our platform, that can be visible in private app extension logs or can be accessed via log tracing system. Read more in docs: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extensions-sdk#send-custom-log-messages-for-debugging>

Is there any request headers like `X-HubSpot-Signature-V3` (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/crm-cards#request-signatures>) that can be added to serverless function calls? Wondering what the best practice from calling to (our own) external endpoints would be to verify that the request is actually coming from HubSpot?
